dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the Kazakh Foreign Ministry is actually in talks to try and lower that fee. It's a big part of these new negotiations with the EU.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan is in talks with the European Union to ease visa requirements, which could eventually lead to lower Schengen visa fees for Kazakh citizens, according to the country's Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, Aibek Smadiyarov, their spokesperson, he made it clear this isn't gonna be a quick process. It involves all 27 Schengen countries, so it's uh, pretty complex.

'Visa liberalization is not something that happens overnight'it's a complex issue involving Kazakhstan and all Schengen countries,' Smadiyarov stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he also mentioned something really important about the application process itself. He urged citizens to be completely honest with their paperwork.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he also mentioned something really important about the application process itself. He urged citizens to be completely honest with their paperwork.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also urged Kazakh citizens applying for visas to be honest and provide accurate documentation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Because there have been issues, right? Like fake documents or people misrepresenting why they're traveling.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 'There have been many instances of falsified documents, fake certificates, or applicants misrepresenting the purpose of their visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He said that kind of thing doesn't just hurt one person's application; it can affect how all Kazakh travelers are viewed, which is a huge deal for future negotiations.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 'This affects not only the individual's profile but also the overall perception of Kazakh travelers, potentially impacting future applications for everyone,' he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So it's not just about the money, it's also about building that trust. I was wondering, though, um, if your visa gets denied, do you get that 90 euro fee back?

dialogue_turns.text: Apparently not. Smadiyarov said consular fees are non-refundable everywhere, like that's just standard international practice.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When asked whether the consular fee could be refunded, Smadiyarov noted that such refunds are not standard practice internationally. 'Consular fees are non-refundable in any country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But they are actively discussing lowering the fee itself, which is the main goal. It's just one of many points on the table.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they are actively discussing lowering the fee itself, which is the main goal. It's just one of many points on the table.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 'However, we are in discussions to reduce the consular fee. There are still many points to negotiate, but we hope to reach a mutual agreement with our European partners,' he added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like they're laying the groundwork for a bigger agreement on mutual visa simplification. That's the endgame here.

dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's a long road, but starting the talks is a huge first step for Kazakh citizens who want to travel to Europe.
